Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 12:55PM mrenee68 wrote: I can only say I don't know. I have a huge divot in my armpit and shaving is awful. No razor with a blade for fear of nicking myself and setting of LE, so I use an electric razor which is such a hassle. As for the deodorant I am able to use a solid. Sorry I'm not much help. Feeling frustrated also.
Posts.Title: Still using spray deoderant CherylinOhio itsjustme10

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2013 12:20AM mrenee68 wrote: The drains are the pits, they can cause a lot of pain and discomfort. Once they come out you feel like a whole new person. I had a little burning when my PS pulled them out but not bad. Hang in there ladies, this to shall pass.
Posts.Title: Drain Pain Mellie289 Mellie289

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2012 06:01AM mrenee68 wrote: I just had my unilateral MX Oct. 1 with tissue expander. In recovery they didn't give me any pain meds so by the time I got to my room I was in intense pain. I was crying telling my husband I would have rather had another c-section (I have had 2). Once the pain was under control it was manageable. Take the pain meds if you need them you can't heal if you are in pain. You will need help for awhile, take the time and rest. I have had a problem with some of my skin dying, so I have had 100 cc removed from my expander and have to treat my skin with ointment twice a day trying to save it. The drains by the way are a hassle and do cause discomfort. You can do it, just take one day at a time, sometimes one hour or even one minute. Big hugs to you!
Posts.Title: scared how much it is going to hurt Mother4Life curveball

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2013 10:48AM mrenee68 wrote: I agree with Beesie, my stereotactic biopsy came back as ADH so my BS recommended an excisional biopsy to make sure there was nothing else going on and sure enough the pathology came back as DCIS, actually in several areas. My only option then was a MX. I say go ahead with the surgery, no it's not fun, but it may save your life.

Posts.Title: Will they do my surgery if I'm on my period? bigshirley softness1

Posts.Content: May 14, 2013 12:04PM mrenee68 wrote: Joan so nicely put. AJ has made a very personal decision and has chosen to share her decision with the world. I would have hoped that others could be more understanding and not pass judgement. I only had a single MX and it was one of the most heart wrenching decisions I have ever had to make. I had many women tell me it was a personal decision and something I had to be able to live with, and I'm still working on that. What we have to realize is that what works for one person may not work for another. We have to make a decision with the information we have and what we feel will give us the best life possible. We all have our own journey in life.

Take it one day at a time and remember you are entitled to cry as much as you need to. ((Hugs))

Posts.Title: Pain - expander area and in armpit - can expander shift ? Nancybc mrenee68

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2012 10:27AM mrenee68 wrote: Yes that would be possible. I don't have any feeling in that area anyway, but I took a pain pill after because I was afraid I might have pain when the numbing wore off. The next day I felt tight and my shoulder was a little stiff, but doable. My procedure took about an hour.
Posts.Title: Necrotic Tissue CarlaInNC mrenee68

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2012 09:24AM mrenee68 wrote: CarlalnNC, Debridement is the removal of the dead tissue. I had a large area removed last Friday. My PS did it in the office. He numbed me up just to make sure I didn't feel anything, cut out the dead skin and stitched my back up. I go back next week to have the stitches removed and maybe I can start the filling process. I did the ointment for several weeks and in my case it didn't help. That area of skin just didn't have adequate blood supply. Unfortunately it's up to your body, so rest, eat healthy, and keep you plans flexible. Wishing you the best!
Posts.Title: Necrotic Tissue CarlaInNC mrenee68

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2012 11:49AM mrenee68 wrote: Hope all is well. It really is easier than it sounds. Very little discomfort and a bit of tightness. Do take it easy for the first 24hrs and then you should be fine. My PS kept my stitches in an extra week and did my first fill of 60cc. I go back this Wednesday and get them out and maybe another fill. Healing thoughts are heading your way! Keep us updated.
Posts.Title: Necrotic Tissue CarlaInNC mrenee68

You can do this you really can. Hang in there and try and stay busy. I wish you luck and B9 results. Embrace the suck!

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 09:35AM mrenee68 wrote: Thank you again ladies you all are such a help in figuring all of this out. I guess I just have a hard time with my expectations with my stage 2 surgery. My TE has been leaking since before Christmas so I have had to continue with fills instead of waiting a month for the exchange. So really I don't even know how I will look, it's been full and then slowly deflates and I lose what volume I had. As for the loss of nipple sensation, that does bother me some, but I don't have a lot of sensation on that side. It was my left nipple that was my "on" button, but it's gone now so I have to move on. Thanks everyone!

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2013 02:39PM mrenee68 wrote: TB90 - you have a difficult and personal decision a head of you. I made the choice to keep my "healthy" breast and deal with whatever the future has for me. I had a hard time being okay with removing one breast let alone removing a breast that at this time is healthy. Do I regret my choice, not at all. It is stressful when it comes close to time for my recheck, but not as much as the stress and discomfort I have been through with my MX and reconstruction. Think it through and do what is right for you and what you can live with. Remember once it is gone there is not going back. Good luck!
